title: Court upholds Prop 50, allowing California to use its redrawn congressional maps
desc: A panel for the U.S. Central District Court of California ruled Democrats can proceed in using their redrawn congressional maps for the 2026 midterm elections.

title: Judge lets ICE operations in Minnesota continue for now
desc: A judge on Wednesday declined to issue a temporary restraining order against U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement operations in Minnesota. CBS News Minnesota investigative reporter Jonah Kaplan has the details.

title: 12/16: The Takeout with Major Garrett
desc: New "enhanced" video of Brown University shooting suspect released; White House chief of staff Susie Wiles gives candid interview on Trump administration.

title: Watch: Trump takes questions, claims killing of Iran protesters "has stopped"
desc: President Trump took questions in the Oval Office Wednesday, speaking about Iran, the economy, Greenland and more. See his remarks.

title: 12/8: The Takeout with Major Garrett
desc: President Trump blasts Marjorie Taylor Greene after her "60 Minutes" interview; Supreme Court hears arguments over firing of FTC commissioner.

title: 12/1: The Takeout with Major Garrett
desc: White House defends second strike on alleged drug boat; New details on National Guard shooting suspect's mental health.

title: Former U.S. gymnast and proponent of transgender athlete bans weighs in on Supreme Court cases
desc: Jennifer Sey is a former U.S. gymnast who now runs the company XX-XY Athletics, which supports banning transgender women from competing in women's sports. Sey joined CBS News to discuss the Supreme Court cases over state laws in West Virginia and Idaho that ban transgender athletes from participating in girls and women's sports.

title: Trump admin. cuts grants for mental health, addiction treatment programs
desc: The U.S. Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration, SAMHSA, lost around $1.9 billion in federal grants, which were abruptly terminated on Tuesday, a source said.

title: "Fundamental" differences remain over Greenland's future, Denmark says after U.S. meeting
desc: After the meeting, Denmark's foreign minister said they're eager to work with the U.S. while respecting the "red lines of the Kingdom of Denmark."

title: FBI searches home of Washington Post journalist for classified documents
desc: The FBI's search is part of a probe into a federal employee suspected of mishandling classified information, Attorney General Pam Bondi said.

title: Trump says "killing in Iran is stopping," with "no plan for executions"
desc: Potentially thousands have died from the crackdown to quash unrest amid protests.

title: U.S. says it's moving into next phase of Gaza peace plan, warns Hamas
desc: Steve Witkoff said the U.S. expects Hamas to immediately return the final deceased hostage as part of its obligations under the deal.

title: Democratic Rep. Jason Crow contacted by Justice Dept. after video to troops
desc: Rep. Jason Crow of Colorado and five other lawmakers appeared in a video that urged U.S. service members to refuse legal orders.

title: Prices for streaming services jumped nearly 20% between November and December, BLS finds
desc: Subscriptions for streaming services saw a nearly 20% jump in prices between November and December, new data from the Labor Department shows. That includes streaming services like Netflix, Disney Plus and Paramount Plus. Alex Weprin, a senior editor for the Holywood Reporter who's written about the rising prices, joins CBS News to discuss. Paramount Skydance is the parent company of CBS News.

title: Verizon customers report phone service outages across U.S.
desc: A Verizon spokesperson confirmed to CBS News that the company is aware of "an issue impacting wireless voice and data services for some customers."

title: Apple, Google face pressure to remove X and Grok from their app stores
desc: Grok faces mounting scrutiny from government officials and advocacy groups after people used the AI chatbot to create sexualized images of minors and women.

title: Verizon cell phone outages reported across U.S.
desc: More than 150,000 Verizon users across the country are experiencing outages. Verizon said, in part, "Our Engineers are engaged and are working to identify and solve the issue quickly."

title: Vance and Rubio meet with officials from Greenland and Denmark
desc: Vice President JD Vance and Secretary of State Marco Rubio hosted foreign ministers from Greenland and Denmark on Wednesday as President Trump continues to insist on a U.S. takeover of Greenland. CBS News senior White House correspondent Weijia Jiang has more.

title: U.S. reduces some personnel at Qatar airbase as Trump threatens action in Iran
desc: The U.S. is withdrawing a some personnel from a major U.S. airbase in Qatar as a "precautionary measure," a U.S. official tells CBS News. Alex Vatanka, senior fellow at the Middle East Institute, joins with his analysis of the situation, and CBS News White House reporter Olivia Rinaldi has the latest on the Trump administration's plans.

title: Saks Global, century-old high-end department store chain, files for bankruptcy
desc: The venerable retailer is seeking protection from its creditors after its $2.65 billion purchase of Nieman Marcus failed to spark growth.

title: People help deer stuck on ice and more videos of good Samaritans helping others
desc: CBS News' Shanelle Kaul shares some stories of good Samaritans helping others, including people who helped a deer stuck on ice and a man who rescued two toddlers crossing a highway.

title: U.S. used aircraft painted like civilian plane to attack alleged drug boat
desc: The attack on an alleged drug-smuggling boat from Venezuela killed 11 people in September.

title: U.S. used painted aircraft resembling civilian plane in deadly Sept. 2 boat strike, sources say
desc: The U.S. military used an aircraft painted like a civilian plane during its deadly Sept. 2 attack targeting a boat allegedly transporting drugs, officials say. CBS News Pentagon reporter Eleanor Watson has more.

title: Supreme Court revives congressman's suit challenging law for late-arriving ballots
desc: The Supreme Court ruled 7-2 in favor of Illinois Rep. Michael Bost, a Republican.

title: Demand for high-achiever visas fuels pay-to-play market for credentials
desc: Demand has risen for the EB-1A visa, creating a cottage industry of services for vanity awards, ghostwritten research papers and "profile building" services. USCIS is investigating potential fraud.

title: White House defends Trump after he appeared to flip off heckler
desc: The White House defended a video that appeared to show President Trump flipping off a person who yelled at him while touring a Ford factory in Michigan on Tuesday.

title: ACA enrollment sinks sharply as coverage costs soar in 2026
desc: Roughly 1.4 million fewer Americans have signed up for an Affordable Care Act plan as expiring tax breaks drive up premiums.

title: Feds sending more agents into Mpls., days after killing of Renee Good
desc: Families of people who have been killed by law enforcement in Minnesota gathered Monday to extend their support to Renee Good's family, less than a week after the 37-year-old was shot and killed by an ICE agent.

title: Family of Renee Good says she was "relentlessly hopeful and optimistic"
desc: The family of Renee Good said in a written statement that she was "the beautiful light of our family and brought joy to anyone she met."
